text: I'm Christina I've been with AWS since
September
2020 and I'm an account manager in the
public sector team here in Switzerland
and we work with different customers on
the one hand we have federal government
as well as local government and on the
other hand we work with state-owned
companies Healthcare institutions
educational institutions broadcasting
companies so there's a vast majority of
different sectors where constantly
involved with which makes it very
interesting and as an account manager I
work with my customers backwards from
their needs and try to identify what
they need in order to make sure they can
succeed in their business goals in order
to work at AWS you don't need a
technical background so for instance I
studied business administration with a
focus on marketing I then spend some
time in the banking and Automotive
Industries uh joining Amazon um about 5
years ago in retail and then uh one year
and a half ago uh I came to AWS I think
when you join from outside you think of
AWS as this big global company with
Steve processes uh where you cannot
change and much but actually when you
join you have this Dynamic environment
with a startup feeling and as we say
it's always uh day one so everything is
possible and you can really change
things uh for the best
